message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The most common genetic abnormality in Wilms tumor, which is the most likely diagnosis in this case, is a deletion or mutation of the WT1 gene on chromosome 11. Therefore, the correct answer is option B. Options A, C, and D are not commonly associated with Wilms tumor.
